title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points, leading the Boston Celtics to a 109-108 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers.
The Celtics maintained a .500 record with their win, marking their third consecutive victory this NBA season.
Celtics and 76ers both secured 56 rebounds each, but Boston had a higher number of offensive boards, 16-9.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox faced backlash for her Halloween costume mimicking Jacqueline Kennedy's bloodied suit from JFK's assassination.
Jack Schlossberg, grandson of JFK, criticized Fox's costume choice on social media, calling it "disgusting and dangerous."
Fox defended her outfit as a statement on trauma and femininity, highlighting Jackie's decision to wear her blood-stained clothes.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr. and WR Drake London will play against the Patriots after recovering from injuries.
Drake London ranks sixth among NFL WRs, with 38 catches on 63 targets, averaging 78.2 yards per game.
Patriots' CB Christian Gonzalez, who hasn't allowed a touchdown in 478 snaps, will face London in Week 9.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow believes the Red Sox are in a better position to acquire key players this offseason.
The team faces potential roster gaps with Alex Bregman opting out and options on Lucas Giolito and Trevor Story.
Red Sox have $25 million under the luxury tax threshold and a strong farm system to aid roster improvements.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel, Patriots head coach, denies changes are to separate from past successes, focusing instead on current team needs.
Vrabel implemented new pregame introductions, shifting from team to individual starter announcements, ending a 24-year tradition.
Despite some missteps, Vrabel's changes have contributed to Patriots' success, with a 6-2 record leading the AFC East.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm will miss several weeks due to a lower-body injury sustained in a game against the Sabres.
Marat Khusnutdinov is promoted to the Bruins' first-line center position, replacing injured Lindholm.
Lindholm was a key contributor, scoring four power play goals and averaging 18:22 of ice time in 12 games.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Tourists in costume filled Salem, Massachusetts, for Halloween 2025, visiting historic sites and capturing the festive spirit.
Key attractions included Essex Street, decorated restaurants, metaphysical gift shops, and the Salem Witch Museum.
Activities featured a Witches’ Circle, street performances, and visits to the Salem Witch Trials Memorial.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused President Trump of abusing young girls with Jeffrey Epstein without providing evidence during a TV interview.
Moulton's accusations arose during an exchange on MSNBC, where he claimed Trump is linked to Epstein files.
MSNBC host Joe Scarborough challenged Moulton, noting there is no evidence of Trump's criminal wrongdoing with Epstein.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's next court dates set: competency hearing Nov. 14, trial conference Nov. 17, jury selection Nov. 18.
Judge orders cell evidence preservation; Walshe's defense seeks access to ex-Trooper Michael Proctor's phone data.
Prosecutors allege Brian Walshe killed Ana Walshe; case delayed due to prior assault on Walshe in prison.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Star Market over the Massachusetts Turnpike reopened after a three-day closure due to an asbestos scare.
Newton Health officials shut down the store following MassDEP's notification of potential asbestos exposure during stockroom demolition.
MassDEP confirmed no asbestos detection in air and surfaces, allowing Star Market to reopen with contained abatement measures ongoing.
